intro: Drypetes ituriensis var. pilosa, commonly known as the pilose drypetes, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy or pubescent stems and leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. This species is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
